content:
Is there a place on zulip where maintainers of doc.rust-lang.org (the website) are?

Or should I just open an issue as per the CONTRIBUTING.md?
If it's about rustdoc, @Joshua Nelson is around, but filing an issue is fine, too

It's about the website, namely the static assets deployed on doc.rust-lang.org/std. I'd like to underatand the workflow that generates those files.

Think I'll ping one the people I see commenting the issues on https://github.com/rust-lang/www.rust-lang.org/issues :)

They're generated by rustdoc.

  • If you're interested to build the docs for your crate, you can use cargo doc. See the rustdoc book for more informations.
  • If you're interested to build the stdlib docs, you can use ./x.py doc --stage 1 library/std. See this page on the rustc dev book for more informations
  • If you're interested in the rustdoc internals, you can read this page on the rustdoc internal.

thanks for the hints. Now I have a bit more context.

I'm just missing how the static assets os the std library are deployed on doc.rust-lang.org. I see www.rust-lang.org is built with a dockerfile but I don't see how doc.rust-lang.org is being cooked. I'll figure that out .
If you want to know how the assets are copied onto the website, you probably want to ask T-infra: #t-infra
Rustdoc generates the assets, T-infra manages deployment via CI.
You can also ask T-rustdoc questions in #rustdoc!

Camelid said:

Probably something in src/ci/ or .github/workflows

yup, Pietro Albini gave me a quick overview
